text.p: Norwegian telecommunications company Nera is expected to post nine-month profits before tax of around 100 million crowns, up from 97 million crowns in the same year-ago period, according to six analysts polled by Reuters.
Four analysts said buy and two recommended investors to sell the share.
One of the analysts who issued a sell recommendation said he nevertheless had confidence in the company's future growth prospects.

"The company is sound, but the share has become too expensive," the analyst said. "Nera can be divided in a satellite division and a radio link division. Internationally, satellite companies are cheaper than radio link companies, and one should weigh Nera's two divisions accordingly to find the correct value of the share."
Other analysts said 1996 would be an exceptional year for Nera as the company had invested heavily in increased production capacity in order to meet growing demand, notably in South East Asia.

"Parts of the Nera's operations have not been good so far this year," said one analyst. "But the problems are resolved and the company is in a market which we believe will grow very strongly in the future."
Nera will present nine-month results on October 28.
